epoetics.core

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • epoetics.core.Linguistic_Element
      • epoetics.core.Document
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Document
extends Linguistic_Element
    This class represents a document, the logically largest unit, the artefact containing all linguistic elements like chapters, sentences, tokens. This is why only this class has meta_data, because it is the equivalent of document types like technical manuals, books and articles, which have meta-data, while chapters usually don't have metadata.
    Author:
    Andreas Müller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> meta_data
        A map from names of metadata fields to the values stored in those fields. All names and values are stored as strings.

      • offset_to_token_map

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> offset_to_token_map
        A map from character offsets to tokens. This map links annotations to the linguistic and representational (see Conceptual Documentation) hierarchy. (?)

      • text_units

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<Annotation>> text_units
        A map from type names to lists of annotations of the respective type. This map is used for all non-standard (see Conceptual Documentation) annotations.

        java.lang.String title
        The title of the document.

        List of the tokens in the document.

    • Method Detail

      • BuildHierarchy

        public void BuildHierarchy()
        Builds the linguistic and conceptual hierarchy. For example, for each sentence the paragraph (or paragraphs in the case of a sentence which overlaps more than one paragraph).

        public void setOffset_to_token_map(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> offset_to_token_map)
        Set the map from character offsets to tokens. This method can, but should not be used directly. The method is used by the MakeOffsetToTokenMap method which computes the map.
